subs.text: July 2022
subs.name: july2022

subs.text: July 11

@davewiner Yes. In 1974, in southeast Alaska, a driver who gave a lift said he was just back from Anchorage, where he saw an unfamiliar thing hanging over the road. “Wow,” he reported saying, “wow, that thing must be a stoplight.”
subs.rawText: @davewiner Yes. In 1974, in southeast Alaska, a driver who gave a lift said he was just back from Anchorage, where he saw an unfamiliar thing hanging over the road. “Wow,” he reported saying, “wow, that thing must be a stoplight.”

subs.text: School teaches the wrong things a good part of the time, but wouldn't have to. Here's the whole "There should be a week-long unit in school each year" collection to date. [link]
subs.rawText: School teaches the wrong things a good part of the time, but wouldn't have to. Here's the whole "There should be a week-long unit in school each year" collection to date. https://t.co/tehLNM9tz6

subs.text: There should be a week-long unit in school each year detailing the ways the powerful, for the sake of appearances, post their plans in various out-of-the-way places "for public viewing and comment" before they smash a fist down on that big green GO button right there on the desk. [link] https://t.co/lKJ9JBiwop

subs.text: July 10

As mayor, at public gatherings, @PeteButtigieg made a point of talking to anyone who indicated that they hoped to have a word. He was speaking with people he knew well once when I walked up. In a moment or two he excused himself from those folks and turned to me, a stranger. [link]
subs.rawText: As mayor, at public gatherings, @PeteButtigieg made a point of talking to anyone who indicated that they hoped to have a word. He was speaking with people he knew well once when I walked up. In a moment or two he excused himself from those folks and turned to me, a stranger. https://t.co/scxS6MJ8NP

subs.text: War-oriented countries like Russia and the U. S. avoid a military draft so that citizens don’t become activists. Instead, the U. S. cynically and unfairly relies in part on folks with family traditions of military service. Via @NYTimes. [link]
subs.rawText:
War-oriented countries like Russia and the U. S. avoid a military draft so that citizens don’t become activists. Instead, the U. S. cynically and unfairly relies in part on folks with family traditions of military service.

Via @NYTimes.
https://t.co/07O9rWDACK

subs.text: @lisajpetrie On a trip last August, our car's AC broke and we crossed western and northern Iowa with the windows down. From great distances we sniffed approaching CAFOs, which were plentiful. One or two employee cars parked outside each building, a dismal portrait of a once-proud rural life.
subs.rawText: @lisajpetrie On a trip last August, our car's AC broke and we crossed western and northern Iowa with the windows down. From great distances we sniffed approaching CAFOs, which were plentiful. One or two employee cars parked outside each building, a dismal portrait of a once-proud rural life.

subs.text: Here @nytDavidBrooks traces a psychological progression that many mass shooters may follow. Next question: What is it about our society that sets a substantial number of people, "a steady stream of young men," as he says, on this path? [link]

subs.text: Western writers evaluated and gave names to the actions of Czech people trying to live freer lives, and these names given by others often simplified and obscured parts of the story. Havel suggests this in the opening lines of "The power of the powerless," the essay, not the book.
subs.rawText: Western writers evaluated and gave names to the actions of Czech people trying to live freer lives, and these names given by others often simplified and obscured parts of the story. Havel suggests this in the opening lines of "The power of the powerless," the essay, not the book.

subs.text: July 6

"We know that in so many of these mass shootings that are now becoming weekly events that the guns are being obtained legally. That should tell all of us that the laws aren't doing their job, if people can't go out to enjoy a 4th of July parade…” [link]

subs.text: July 5

Not quite a week yet, but I asked our regional grocery chain about people carrying guns in the stores--whether or not they have a policy about that. I asked here and by email. No reply either place. [link]

subs.text:
A neighbor says, roughly, that
having a rape/incest exception
means that

"The only time you can allow women
to make up their own mind
about their bodies and their lives
is when someone has
treated them with great brutality."
